data.title: 2016 Movie Titles: Rise of the Colons – From ‘Captain America’ to ‘Rogue One’
data.meta_description: With Hollywood drowning in a sea of sequels, mid-title punctuation has reached a record high
data.text:
There’s a punctuation party raging throughout Hollywood, which is in desperate need of a colon cleanse.

This year alone, Hollywood will release 20 films with colons in their titles, which appears to be a record. The colon proliferation is indicative of the industry’s reliance on sequels and reboots that need to distinguish themselves from their predecessors with a pair of dots and a subtitle.

And we’re not even counting all the foreign films and documentaries released in less than 100 theaters, projects like “We Steal Secrets: The Story of WikiLeaks,” “Cinco de Mayo: La Batalla” and “Ai Weiwei: Never Sorry.”

The trend has spread from wide releases at major studios to films from specialty labels such as Fox Searchlight (“Absolutely Fabulous: the Movie”), Sony Pictures Classics (“The Raid: Redemption”) and Radius-TWC (“Escobar: Paradise Lost”).

Hollywood seems to be breaking its own record this year, as last year there were 16 films that qualified. Meanwhile, of the 20 titles this year with colons, 13 are sequels, one is a reboot, one is a spinoff, one is based on a TV series, one is a concert film, one is an original comedy and two are based on books.

There’s no end in sight to the colon craziness, as films on the horizon in 2017 include “Alien: Covenant,” “xXx: The Return of Xander Cage,” “Amityville: The Awakening,” “Resident Evil: The Final Chapter,” “John Wick: Chapter Two,” “Maze Runner: The Death Cure,” “Kong: Skull Island,” “Knights of the Roundtable: King Arthur,” “Smurfs: The Lost Village,” “Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales,” “The Divergent Series: Ascendant” and “Spider-Man: Homecoming.”

Heck, even Netflix has been getting in on the action of late with “Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon: Sword of Destiny.”

Take a look at the colon epidemic below and hit the comments section if you have any suggestions on how to fix this punctuation problem.

13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi

The Divergent Series: Allegiant

Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice
